channel.title: Tips on making a great Martin Garrix, Hardwell type build up?
channel.description: I am wanting to know solid tips on making an epic build up before the drop. Whenever I listen to the big guys like Garrix, Hardwell etc, I am amazed at the tension and build ups that they produce. Being fairly new to producing, this is something that I struggle with making like I want it to sound. Was wondering if anyone could give some insight?

item.title: Tips on making a great Martin Garrix, Hardwell type build up?
item.dc:creator: CNCRDIA
item.description:
Maybe try using a bit of high pass before the “drop” on all instruments. It helps get some suspension.

…and a 1/2 bar break with a small, simple fill would be cool.

Hope this helps!

item.title: Tips on making a great Martin Garrix, Hardwell type build up?
item.dc:creator: SpaghettiSauce
item.description:
What I think they do, is turning down the volume, or isolating the melody right before the drop, to make the drop sound more heavy. Also, risers. They add a lot of tension.
